railway.draw

Class NetworkRenderer

  • java.lang.Object
    • railway.draw.NetworkRenderer

  • public class NetworkRenderer
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that contains methods to set the layout of the network

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      NetworkRenderer(Network network) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      NetworkComp draw(LayoutController layoutController)
      get a network component from the network object
      Component getCompById(int id)
      get a component by it's id
      void leveler(Block block, Point point, java.lang.Boolean backwards, int index, Network network, int level)
      set the correct level and index for every component so it can snap to a grid, Algorithm works by levelling the very end branches first and then working backwards in order to create a nested branch structure where none overlap
      void setLevels(Block block, java.lang.Boolean backwards, int index, int level, java.lang.Boolean dontlevel)
      recursively iterate through a 'flat route of points' and set the level of them, for instance for network: ______ ___/______\_____ abc defghi jklmn the path will be through the bottom level where the point splits and so will be 'abcdefhijklmn', and all components on this path will be set to level 0

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getCompById

        public Component getCompById(int id)
        get a component by it's id
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the component to get
        Returns:
        the component

      • leveler

        public void leveler(Block block,
                    Point point,
                    java.lang.Boolean backwards,
                    int index,
                    Network network,
                    int level)
        set the correct level and index for every component so it can snap to a grid, Algorithm works by levelling the very end branches first and then working backwards in order to create a nested branch structure where none overlap
        Parameters:
        block - the starting block
        point - the point that y is joined to, parsed in order to set the level
        backwards - set if the algorithm is now travelling backwards through the network
        index - the current index
        network - the network object
        level - the level to start from

      • setLevels

        public void setLevels(Block block,
                      java.lang.Boolean backwards,
                      int index,
                      int level,
                      java.lang.Boolean dontlevel)
        recursively iterate through a 'flat route of points' and set the level of them, for instance for network: ______ ___/______\_____ abc defghi jklmn the path will be through the bottom level where the point splits and so will be 'abcdefhijklmn', and all components on this path will be set to level 0
        Parameters:
        block - the current block
        backwards - whether or not to travel backwards through the network
        index - current index
        level - current level
        dontlevel - if set, no blocks are levelled, but they are still indexed

      • draw

        public NetworkComp draw(LayoutController layoutController)
        get a network component from the network object
        Returns:
        drawing of the network
